maml:description.maml:para: Gets Backup properties.
The Get-AzRecoveryServicesBackupProperty cmdlet gets backup properties for a Recovery Services vault.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the vault. The vault must be an AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the vault. The vault must be an AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the backup vault property for vault.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of Recovery Services vaults.
The Get-AzRecoveryServicesVault cmdlet gets a list of Recovery Services vaults in the current subscription.
Specifies the name of the Azure resource group from which to retrieve the specified Recovery Services object.
Specifies the name of the vault to query for.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the Tags to query for
Specifies the name of the Azure resource group from which to retrieve the specified Recovery Services object.
Specifies the name of the vault to query for.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the Key of the Tag to query for
Specifies the Value of the Tag to query for
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the vault to query for.
Specifies the name of the Azure resource group from which to retrieve the specified Recovery Services object.
Specifies the Tags to query for
Specifies the Key of the Tag to query for
Specifies the Value of the Tag to query for

maml:alert.maml:para: Get-AzRecoveryServicesVault in old version of Az.RecoveryServices(<=2.10.0) cannot work with Az.Accounts(>=1.8.1) because of incorrect assembly reference. The module Az.RecoveryServices needs to be upgraded to 2.11.0 or newer if you are using the latest Az or Az.Accounts.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the list of vault in selected subscription.
Get the list of vault in resource group in selected subscription.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $vault = Get-AzRecoveryServicesVault -ResourceGroupName "resourceGroup" -Name "vaultName" PS C:\> $vault.Identity | fl
PrincipalId : XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX TenantId : XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX Type : SystemAssigned

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first cmdlet gets the vault in resource group with given name. Then we access the MSI information from the vault.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the Azure Site Recovery vault settings file.
The Get-AzRecoveryServicesVaultSettingsFile cmdlet gets the settings file for an Azure Site Recovery vault.
Specifies the Azure Site Recovery vault object.
Specifies the path to the Azure Site Recovery vault settings file. You can download this file from the Azure Site Recovery vault portal and store it locally.
Indicates the vault credentials file is applicable to Azure Backup.
{{Fill Certificate Description}}
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the Azure Site Recovery vault object.
Specifies the path to the Azure Site Recovery vault settings file. You can download this file from the Azure Site Recovery vault portal and store it locally.
{{Fill Certificate Description}}
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the site friendly name. Use this parameter if you are downloading the vault credentials for a Hyper-V site.
Specifies the site identifier. Use this parameter if you are downloading the vault credentials for a Hyper-V site.
Indicates the vault credentials file is applicable to Azure Site Recovery.
Specifies the Azure Site Recovery vault object.
Specifies the path to the Azure Site Recovery vault settings file. You can download this file from the Azure Site Recovery vault portal and store it locally.
{{Fill Certificate Description}}
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Indicates the vault credentials file is applicable to Azure Site Recovery.
Indicates the vault credentials file is applicable to Azure Backup.
{{Fill Certificate Description}}
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the path to the Azure Site Recovery vault settings file. You can download this file from the Azure Site Recovery vault portal and store it locally.
Specifies the site friendly name. Use this parameter if you are downloading the vault credentials for a Hyper-V site.
Specifies the site identifier. Use this parameter if you are downloading the vault credentials for a Hyper-V site.
Indicates the vault credentials file is applicable to Azure Site Recovery.
Specifies the Azure Site Recovery vault object.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Register a Windows Server or DPM machine for Azure Backup
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Vault01 = Get-AzRecoveryServicesVault -Name "TestVault" PS C:\> $CredsPath = "C:\Downloads" PS C:\> $Credsfilename = Get-AzRecoveryServicesVaultSettingsFile -Backup -Vault $Vault01 -Path $CredsPath

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the vault named TestVault, and then stores it in the $Vault01 variable. The second command sets the $CredsPath variable to C:\Downloads. The last command gets the vault credentials file for $Vault01 using the credentials in $CredsPath for Azure Backup.
The command gets the vault credentials file for $Vault01 of vault type siteRecovery.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Register a Windows Server or DPM machine for Azure Backup

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command gets the vault credentials file for $Vault01.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Recovery Services vault.
The New-AzRecoveryServicesVault cmdlet creates a new Recovery Services vault.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the geographic location of the vault.
Specifies the name of the vault to create.
Specifies the name of the Azure resource group in which to create or from which to retrieve the specified Recovery Services object.
Specifies the Tags to add to the Recovery Services Vault
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the geographic location of the vault.
Specifies the name of the vault to create.
Specifies the name of the Azure resource group in which to create or from which to retrieve the specified Recovery Services object.
Specifies the Tags to add to the Recovery Services Vault
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create recovery service vault in resource group and given location.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes a Recovery Services vault.
The Remove-AzRecoveryServicesVault cmdlet deletes a Recovery Services vault.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies an Azure Site Recovery vault object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies an Azure Site Recovery vault object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Sets the properties for backup management.
The Set-AzRecoveryServicesBackupProperty cmdlet sets backup storage properties for a Recovery Services vault.
Specifies the backup storage redundancy type.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the vault. The vault must be an AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs.
Specifies the backup storage redundancy type.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the vault. The vault must be an AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault object.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs.

command:example.maml:title: ------- Example 1: Set GeoRedundant storage for a vault -------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Vault01 = Get-AzRecoveryServicesVault -Name "TestVault" PS C:\> Set-AzRecoveryServicesBackupProperty -Vault $Vault01 -BackupStorageRedundancy GeoRedundant

dev:remarks.maml:para: The first command gets the vault named TestVault, and then stores it in the $Vault01 variable. The second command sets the backup storage redundancy for $Vault01 to GeoRedundant.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets vault context.
The Set-AzRecoveryServicesVaultContext cmdlet sets the vault context for Azure Site Recovery services.
Warning: This cmdlet is being deprecated in a future breaking change release. There will be no replacement for it. Please use the -VaultId parameter in all Recovery Services commands going forward.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the vault. The vault must be an AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Specifies the name of the vault. The vault must be an AzureRmRecoveryServicesVault object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $vault = Get-AzRecoveryServicesVault -ResourceGroupName "resourceGroup" -Name "vaultName" PS C:\> Set-AzRecoveryServicesVaultContext -Vault $vault
